etymology.description: 宠(寵) (chǒng, "favor; pamper") + 物(物) (wù, "thing; object") = favored thing -> pet
etymology.interpretation: The word 宠物(寵物) (chǒngwù, "pet") combines 宠(寵) (chǒng, "favor; pamper") and 物(物) (wù, "thing; object"), reflecting the idea of an animal being a favored or pampered object in a household.
etymology.simplification: traditional 寵 simplified to 宠

examples.chinese: 我家养了一只宠物(我家養了一隻寵物)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā yǎng le yī zhī chǒngwù.

examples.chinese: 宠物给我很多快乐(寵物給我很多快樂)，它们总是陪伴我(它們總是陪伴我)。
examples.pinyin: Chǒngwù gěi wǒ hěn duō kuàilè, tāmen zǒng shì péibàn wǒ.
examples.english: Pets bring me a lot of joy, and they always accompany me.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢照顾宠物(我喜歡照顧寵物)，因为它们让我感到温暖(因為它們讓我感到溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān zhàogù chǒngwù, yīnwèi tāmen ràng wǒ gǎn dào wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: I like taking care of pets because they make me feel warm.
